channel.title: CiTR -- Sweet and Hot
channel.description: A celebration of the music of the 1920's, 30's and 40's, from Charleston to Be Bop, Hawaiian, Cuban Big Band and Western Swing.Popular tunes, jazz and swing from 1925 to 1950. Weekly featured artists,guest interviews and more.
channel.itunes:summary: A celebration of the music of the 1920's, 30's and 40's, from Charleston to Be Bop, Hawaiian, Cuban Big Band and Western Swing.Popular tunes, jazz and swing from 1925 to 1950. Weekly featured artists,guest interviews and more.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Popular tunes, jazz and swing from 1925 to 1950.

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Oct-2011
item.description: Sweet & Hot's farewell broadcast. Thanks for listening, friends and music lovers. I will miss bringing the music to you. Keep a song in your heart and remember, It Don't Mean a Thing if It Ain't Got Swing.
item.itunes:subtitle: Broadcast Finale

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Oct-2011
item.description: From Honolulu To Havana: An all-Hawaiian and Cuban show.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Aug-2011
item.description: A tribute to my favorite tenor sax man- Lester Willis Young.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tribute to "Prez" - Lester Young.

item.title: Broadcast on 04-Aug-2011
item.description: Tribute to Pops; his Hot Fives & Sevens but mostly from his 1929-1932 Orchestra.
item.itunes:subtitle: Louis Armstrong Anniversary

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Jun-2011
item.description: A tribute to the King Of Swing.
item.itunes:subtitle: Benny Goodman anniversary tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 26-May-2011
item.description: My yearly tribute to Artie Shaw, "King Of The Clarinet".
item.itunes:subtitle: Artie Shaw Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Apr-2011
item.description: The annual tribute to Edward Kennedy "Duke" Ellington.
item.itunes:subtitle: Duke Ellington Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Mar-2011
item.description: The second hour is a tribute to the great Freddy Green, who played rhythm guitar in the finest of rhythm sections, that of the Count Basie Orchestra.
item.itunes:subtitle: Freddy Green Centennial

item.title: Broadcast on 24-Feb-2011
item.description: A tribute to Billy Strayhorn.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month: Finale

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Feb-2011
item.description: This week's show is a tribute to the multi-instrumentalist, composer, bandleader and leading jazz educator Benny Carter, who enjoyed a career spanning 7 decades.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Feb-2011
item.description: The R&B dance orchestras - Buddy Johnson, Lucky Millinder, Lionel Hampton and others.

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Feb-2011
item.description: This year's Black History Month kicks off with a Sidney Bechet tribute show.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month, 2011.

item.title: Broadcast on 20-Jan-2011
item.description: Big band swing for today's show.

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Nov-2010
item.description: A tribute to the WW2 generation and it's favorite music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Remembrance Day

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Oct-2010
item.description: Local fashion historian Ivan Sayers drops in to share his deep and all-encompassing understanding of the fashions of the 1920's, 30's and 40's.
item.itunes:subtitle: Special Guest: Ivan Sayers

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Sep-2010
item.description: The usual offerings, plus a impromptu "mini feature" on women of 1930's & 40's jazz and swing.

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Aug-2010
item.description: Swingin' the blues with Count Basie 1938-1952 era; Walter Page, Jo Jones, Freddy Greene, Buck Clayton, Lester Young, Jimmy Rushing, Helen Humes, Count Basie, Herschel Evans, Dickie Wells, Buddy Tate, Sweets Edison and the whole gang.
item.itunes:subtitle: Count Basie Anniversary

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Aug-2010
item.itunes:subtitle: Tribute to "The Prez" - A Lester Young Feature

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Aug-2010
item.description: Selections from the Hot 5's and 7's through to the late 1940's, and the Fleischmann's Yeast Radio Program
item.itunes:subtitle: Louis Armstrong Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Jun-2010
item.description: Local Rockabilly and Jazz guitar player Paul Pigat joins me in the studio with some rare, never before heard guitar tracks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Swing and Jazz Guitar Feature with Paul Pigat

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Jun-2010
item.itunes:subtitle: My guest this week: Local Swing Dancer & Instructor Lucy Falkner

item.title: Broadcast on 27-May-2010
item.description: This week marks the 100th anniversary of the birth of one of the legends of the swing era - clarinetist, composer, arranger and author Artie Shaw.
item.itunes:subtitle: Artie Shaw Centenary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Apr-2010
item.description: A yearly tradition - the fourth Duke Ellington anniversary tribute show. Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: Duke Ellington Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Apr-2010
item.description: Saxophone is the instrument of the day. Lester Young, Coleman Hawkins, Illinois Jacquet, Earl Bostic, Big Jay McNeely and others.

item.title: Broadcast on 01-Apr-2010
item.description: April Fool's Day - a whimsical musical offering of The Hoosier Hotshots, Six Jumping Jacks, Stan Freberg, Spike Jones and others.

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Feb-2010
item.description: My interview with the King Of The Honkin' Tenor Sax: Big Jay McNeely

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Jan-2010
item.description: I am joined in the studio by stride piano player Reese Gray of the Firecracker Jazz Band and Jen Hodges, bass player of Company B.

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Dec-2009
item.description: Happy New Year, everyone!

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Dec-2009
item.description: Featured recording: "One Night Stand: Lester Young And Sarah Vaughan, Town Hall Concert; New York 1947".

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Oct-2009
item.description: Music linked to the experience of the stock market crash of 1929- eighty years ago today, and of the Great Depression that followed.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Crash Of '29 A Commemoration.

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Aug-2009
item.description: This year's tribute show features selections from "The Complete Decca Recordings", "America's #1 Band" and others. There is also a radio transcription of the 1957 Newport Jazz Festival which has some amazing solo work by Lester Young, Illinois Jacquet and Roy Eldridge.
item.itunes:subtitle: Count Basie Anniversary Tribute Show

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Aug-2009
item.description: This week's show features a 90 minute tribute to "The Pres" with recordings of Lester Young with Count Basie, Oscar Peterson and others.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tribute To Lester Young

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Jul-2009
item.description: I am joined in the studio by the talented and lively Shannon Scott, Juhli Conlinn and Jen "Hudge" Hudgins. We talk about their new cd, and we play some music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Company B Jazz Band

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jun-2009
item.description: Featured recording: Ella Fitzgerald - Lullabies of Birdland.

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Jun-2009
item.description: Featured recordings: Verve Records' Complete Jazz At The Philarmonic 1944-1949

item.title: Broadcast on 28-May-2009
item.description: Retrospective of the Benny Goodman orchestra and small groups; 1935-1941. Featured recording: Carnegie Hall Concert of January, 1939
item.itunes:subtitle: Benny Goodman Centenary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 21-May-2009
item.description: The annual Artie Shaw tribute show, featuring the 1936-1937, 1938/39 & 1944 orchestras. Snippets and sound bites from the Oscar-winning Brigitte Berman documentary, "Time Is All You've Got"
item.itunes:subtitle: Artie Shaw Anniversary

item.title: Broadcast on 14-May-2009
item.description: Featured recording this week is the Louis Armstrong 1937 Fleishmann's Yeast Show.

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Apr-2009
item.description: A poutpourri of different things.

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Apr-2009
item.description: A love letter to the city. Harlem, Broadway and 42nd Street
item.itunes:subtitle: New York, New York

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Feb-2009
item.description: Wrap up of BHM with hot jazz, and wrapped it up with a love letter to Harlem.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month!

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Feb-2009
item.description: The swing era - 1935 to 1950
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month!

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Feb-2009
item.description: A salute to the true pioneers of early Jazz, awing and R&B.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month!

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Dec-2008
item.description: Featured program on the great Louis Jordan and His Tympany Five.
item.itunes:subtitle: Louis Jordan - Jukebox King

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Nov-2008
item.description: Rounding up the final day of The 2008 Fund Drive. Many thanks to the listeners who were instrumental in reaching CiTR's fundraising goal for this year. We love you, madly!

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Oct-2008
item.description: Songs about alcohol and drugs, from the 1920's to the 50's.
item.itunes:subtitle: Liquor, Gin, Wine & Tea

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Sep-2008
item.description: Filling in for Jason's show.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shake A Tail Feather

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Sep-2008
item.description:
Bassist and bandleader Jennifer Hodge of Company B joins me in the studio for a feature on the history, evolution and the great exponents of the sting bass.
Steve Brown, Thelma Terry, Slam Stewart, John Kirby, Walter Page, Jimmy Blanton and Bill Johnson
item.itunes:subtitle: Feature: The Stand Up Bass

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Sep-2008
item.description: This week's show is a feature on the Tenor Saxophone. Coleman Hawkins, Lester Young, Chu Berry, Big Jay McNeely and others.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Tenor Saxophone

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Aug-2008
item.description:
This week's show is a tribute to the great William "Count" Basie and his great orchestras of 1936 - 1945.
Vocals by Jimmie Rushing, Helen Humes, Paul Robeson and Anita O'Day.
item.itunes:subtitle: Count Basie Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Jul-2008
item.itunes:subtitle: The great dance bands of the 1920's, 30's & 40's.

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Jul-2008
item.description: Selections from the George Gershwin and Irving Berlin songbooks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Songwriters Series

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Jul-2008
item.description: Feature on the songwriters and lyricists of Tin Pan Alley continues this week with Harry Warren and Al Dubin.

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Jun-2008
item.description: First of the featured shows on Tin Pan Alley, with a feature on Andy Razaf.

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Jun-2008
item.description: Pre-1935: Hot Jazz, novelties and some repartee between Marlene Dietrich and Tallulah Bankhead.

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Jun-2008
item.description: Fill in for "Caught In The Red"; I play the R&B masters of the 1940's & 50's. Honkin' saxes and the Blues Shouters.

item.title: Broadcast on 29-May-2008
item.description: A retrospective of the career of Artie Shaw; with excerpts from the NPR interview by Renee Montagne.
item.itunes:subtitle: Artie Shaw: Annual Tribute Show

item.title: Broadcast on 15-May-2008
item.description: By request; a special on the great clarinetists of the Hot Jazz and Swing eras: Johnny Dodds, Wilton Crawley, Barney Bigard, Woody Herman, Artie Shaw and others.
item.itunes:subtitle: Featured Show: Hot Jazz & Swing Clarinet

item.title: Broadcast on 01-May-2008
item.description: 3 hours of the 78 RPM era, and those who keep the traditions alive.
item.itunes:subtitle: Extended Broadcast: All This May!

item.title: Broadcast on 24-Apr-2008
item.description:
A yearly tradition, the last show of April is a celebration of the enduring artistic legacy of the greatest jazz composer of all time - Edward Kennedy "Duke" Ellington. 2 hours of The Duke.
We love you madly!
item.itunes:subtitle: Duke Ellington Anniversary Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Apr-2008
item.description: A potpourri of different things. I had fun. Hope you do, too.

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Apr-2008
item.description: The Kansas City Sound - Bennie Moten, Andy Kirk & Mary Lou Williams, Alphonso Trent, Jay McShann, Albert Ammons and, of course, Count Basie.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kansas City Swing

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Mar-2008
item.description: A special on the great jazz and dance bands of the pre-swing era; 1925 to 1934.

item.title: Broadcast on 20-Mar-2008
item.description: Extended Broadcast, with special guests Juhli Conlinn, Emily Lyall & Shannon Scott from the local band "Company B".

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Mar-2008
item.description: Fill in for "Caught In The Red" - a mix of Honkin',screaming sax and Rockabilly.

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Mar-2008
item.description: Fill in for "Caught In The Red"; a mix of screaming sax and rockabilly. Variety is good.

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Mar-2008
item.description: The second hour of the show features a tribute to Jeff Healey, who regretably left us on March 2nd, 2008.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeff Healey Tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Feb-2008
item.description: Paul Mercer Ellington, son of Mercer Ellington and Grandson of Edward Kennedy Ellington, joins me in the studio for a brief retrospective of the Duke's early career and for an hour of the present-day Duke Ellington Orchestra's book.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month: Duke Ellington Tribute with Paul Mercer Ellington

item.title: Broadcast on 24-Jan-2008
item.description: I am joined in the studio by my guests Jennifer Hodge and Shannon Scott from "Company B".

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Jan-2008
item.description: A mix of things, and a short Bob Wills tribute at the tail end of the show.

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Jan-2008
item.description: Vancouver LIVING entertainment legend Mr. Dal Richards, Vancouver's elder statesman of swing, pops into the studio to share his reminisces of the Big Band Era, and to tell us about his current working band and to tell us about his 90th birthday celebrations and concerts this weekend.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview: Dal Richards

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Dec-2007
item.description: Last show of 2007. Wishing you a Happy New Year!

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Dec-2007
item.description: Extended broadcast; a good mix of Xmas music thrown in.

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Dec-2007
item.description: Very special guest, Bria Skonberg joins me for the show! A talented and award winning Trumpet player, She leads "Bria's Hot Five, co-leads Mighty Aphrodite, and plays with Dal Richards, Simon Stribling and many others. A celebration of some of our favorite trumpet players of yesteryear.
item.itunes:subtitle: Special Guest: Bria Skonberg

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Nov-2007
item.description: A mix of different things; finishing up with a trio of sets from Duke Ellington, Count Basie & Artie Shaw.

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Nov-2007
item.description:
My feature on the orchestra led by Tommy And Jimmy Dorsey, which recorded from 1928-1935. Bunny Berigan, Adrian Rollini and others are also there.
Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: "Sweet & Hot" - Dorsey Brothers Featured Artists

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Nov-2007
item.description:
My tribute to the World War veterans, the home front and featuring music from Glenn Miller, George Formby, Vera Lynn, Grace Fields, John McCormack and others.
Lest We Forget.
item.itunes:subtitle: Remembrance Day Show

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Nov-2007
item.description:
Filling in for my friend and colleague Jason Colantonio: "Shake A Tail Feather"; I play R&B from 1947-1960.
Featured artists included Hadda Brooks, Big Jay McNeely and others.
item.itunes:subtitle: "Shake A Tail Feather"

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Oct-2007
item.description: 4-hour podcast with B-day Anniversary tributes for Charlie Barnet, Eddie Lang & Tony Pastor.

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Sep-2007
item.description: This week's show is a all-1920's broadcast ~ "Oh, play that thing!"
item.itunes:subtitle: All 1920's Show

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Sep-2007
item.description:
The first show after my return to the 10am time slot.
A mix of things, with some Hoagy Carmichael.

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Aug-2007
item.description: Blended broadcast: Jason, who hosts "Shake A Tail Feather" drops in, and we co-host our combined shows for a (very nearly)definitive history of Rhythm and Blues; with recordings ranging from 1928 to 1960.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Roots of Rhythm and Blues

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Aug-2007
item.description: The entire show dedicated to Count Basie, the pride of Red Bank, N.J. and his incredible band. Jimmie Rushing, Helen Humes, Lester Young, Joe Jones, Freddie Green, Walter Page and many others. The years of 1936-1941 are featured, with a little early 50's stuff. Billie Holiday also included.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Count Basie anniversary tribute

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Aug-2007
item.description:
Some vinyl I picked up some time ago- a wonderful series of recordings made between Sept. 1938 and Feb. 1939 by Artie Shaw that were broadcast on NBC live from NYC, The Hotel Lincoln and The Hotel Pennsylvania (now known as the Hotel Statler).
I hope you enjoy these wonderful recordings.
item.itunes:subtitle: Artie Shaw: Live At The Blue Room & Cafe Rouge

item.title: Broadcast on 20-Jul-2007
item.description: Featured artist is Jelly Roll Morton.

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Jul-2007
item.description: A mix of things, including a set of Kansas City Bands. Playlist found on the blog at http://www.myspace.com/citrjazz

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Jul-2007
item.description: An all-Hawaiian music show. Mele a me pila ho'okani!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hawaiian!

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Jun-2007
item.description: One set of hot Harlem mid 30's swing, and the rest, a potpourri. Enjoy.
item.itunes:subtitle: A mix of....

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Jun-2007
item.description: A variety of the sounds of the jazz age - Lee Morse, Bix Beiderbecke, Bennie Moten, The Rhythm Boys, Ben Bernie and others.
item.itunes:subtitle: All 1920's

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Jun-2007
item.description: Fill-in for "Caught In The Red" - expect plenty of kickin' 50s R&B, and Rockabilly.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-May-2007
item.description: Sweet & Hot's Artie Shaw anniversary tribute, and my extended broadcast goes into the 1950's R & B, and some solid 1950's Rockabilly.

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Apr-2007
item.description: Today's show is a Duke Ellington anniversary show- two whole hours of the Duke's magic. Enjoy!

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Mar-2007
item.description: Standard fare, followed by and hour of "The Devil's Music": hot jazz from the likes of Benny Moten, Mr. Jelly Roll and more... "Oh, play that thing!"

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Mar-2007
item.description: Today's show includes a short tribute set dedicated to Betty Hutton.

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Feb-2007
item.description: My final show for Black History Month, and an extended broadcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Feb-2007
item.description: Extended broadcast: four hours of the best of the 1920's,30's & 40's: Hour four is a Count Basie feature.
item.itunes:subtitle: Extended broadcast, Black History month continues

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Feb-2007
item.description: Today's show includes a half-hour of Chick Webb's orchestra, with some vocals by a teenage Ella Fitzgerald.
item.itunes:subtitle: Black History Month

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Feb-2007
item.description: Fill-in for Jason's show "Shake a Tail Feather": R&B hits from the early 40s to around 1960.
item.itunes:subtitle: Fill-in for "Shake A Tail Feather" - hot selection of 40s/50s R & B

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jan-2007
item.description:
A bonus hour of today's show - including a listener-sanctioned "1920's" extravaganza.
Oh, You Kid!

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Dec-2006
item.description: Last show of 2006! Have a happy New Year!

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Dec-2006
item.description: Extended Broadcast: 2006 tributes and a full hour of 1920's hits.

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Dec-2006
item.description: My Hannukwanzamas Show. Happy Holiday, one and all.

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Dec-2006
item.description: My fill-in show for The End Of The World News - a variety of tunes, and a 15 min. Hawaiian set.

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Dec-2006
item.description: Various little Christmas ditties thrown into the mix, and the last hour are a tribute to the three recent passages in the swing/jazz world: Jay McShann, Georgia Gibbs and Martha Tilton

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Dec-2006
item.description: Hour 2 of today's show is an all-1920's hour.

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Nov-2006
item.description: Hour 2 is my tribute to Anita O'Day

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Nov-2006
item.description: This week's show is themed "The Corner of 88 and Crooner": crooners and piano players.

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Nov-2006
item.description: This is the "bonus" hour of this show.

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Nov-2006 Afrobeat AfroKool!
item.itunes:subtitle: Chilling with the beats while my sore jaw heals...wisdom tooth extraction

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Nov-2006
item.description: Part 3 of my tribute to the WW2 generation.

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Nov-2006
item.description: part 2 of my tribute to the WW2 generation.

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Nov-2006
item.description: Part 1 of my tribute to the WW2 generation

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Nov-2006
item.description: Part 3 of today's show: the music of the Great Depression

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Nov-2006
item.description: November 2nd, 2006

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Oct-2006
item.description: part 2: Oct 26, 2006

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Oct-2006
item.description: Part 1, October 26 2006

item.title: Sweet and Hot October 5 Part 1
item.description: First Podcast Ever!
